greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The maximum exponent k of 7 such that 7^k divides n.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} x^(7^k)/(1-x^(7^k)). See A112765. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 18 2014
If n == 0 (mod 7) then a(n) = 1 + a(n/7), otherwise a(n) = 0. - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 05 2020
example: n=147 = 3*7*7 is divisible by 7^2, so a(147)=2.
mathematica: IntegerExponent[Range[150],7] (* Suggested by Amiram Eldar *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 07 2020 *)
results.author: _Redjan Shabani_, Jul 16 2012
